Available Roles:
No Access = 1, Report Consumer = 32, Issue Manager = 256, Report Administrator = 1024, Job Administrator = 32768,

Summary information about any subfolders which this folder contains.
The count of subfolders this folder contains.

Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Base object for any folder item (job, report pack, dashboard). This object is not used directly.
Contact information for this folder item.
The last time this folder item was run.
The last time this folder item was modified. Reserved for future use.
The date this folder item was created.
Current state of this folder item.

State ID.
Available States:
Ready = 1, Starting = 2, Running = 3, Resuming = 6, Canceling = 7, Suspending = 8, Suspended = 9, PostProcessing = 10, Ending = 12,
Localized name of the state of this folder item.
Current action set on this folder item.

Action ID.
Available Actions:
No Action = 0, None = 1, Run = 2, Suspend = 3, Cancel = 4, End = 5, Scheduled Run = 6, Auto Run = 7,
Localized name of the current action set on this folder item.
Represents a Content Scan Job.
Url to the options
Application
Application ID
ScanLog
Url to the scan log
Job Statistics
Url to the job statistics
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Represents a collection of folders.
Object returned when an error occurs during a web service request. This object is accompanied with an HTTP Status of 4xx/5xx.
Serviceability code defining the error that occurred.
This field provides stack trace information for debugging purposes. This is not enabled by default.
Provides information about the error in question.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Link to online help for this error code.
Localized description of the serviceability code.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Represents a Report Pack.
Provides summary information about the collection of reports belonging to this report pack.
Count of reports in this report pack.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Url to access the reports collection.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Represents a Dashboard. Currently dashboard data is not available through web services.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.

Represents a Report object. This object describes basic information about the report, such as the number of issues found. Note that this object is equivalent to the Report Pack Summary in the WebUI. All numbers are current as of the last time the Report Pack was run.
Provides summary data about this report. Equivalent to the summary sentences in the Report Pack Summary Web UI.
Full summary sentence including values.
Summary format excluding values. Placeholders indicate location of values.
Numeric value representing a summary value such as number of issues, number of pages etc.
Position in the summary sentence where this value belongs.

Provides access to a report's raw data. Users requesting this will be returned the table of data displayed in the WebUI (according to the default view). Any default grouping will be removed, and only columns which are visible by default will be returned.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Url to access the report's data (as seen in the WebUI).

Provides access to a report's issues. Note that this is only valid for issue managed reports. Instead of simply returning the table of data, this service will return a collection of issues, representing the data displayed in the 'About This Issue' view in the Web UI.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Url to access the report's collection of issues.
A collection of the counts of issues at various severity levels. Equivalent to the severity columns in Report Pack Summary in the Web UI.
Represents a single issue count, either by severity or status.
Indicates that this issue count is based on severity.
The count of issues in the specified category.
A collection of the counts of issues at various status levels. Equivalent to the status columns in Report Pack Summary in the Web UI.
Represents a single issue count, either by severity or status.
Indicates that this issue count is based on status.
The count of issues in the specified category.
The last time this report was modified.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Represents a collection of folder items (jobs, report packs, dashboards).
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Represents a collection of Reports.
Represents an Import Job.
Application
Application ID
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.

Object returned when a web service request takes longer than the server request timeout. This allows for tasks which take a particularly long time (reports with large amounts of data, or reports with complex data) to continue running on the server. Part of this object is an href, which will allow access to the running task cached on the server. Requesting this URL will attach to the running task and continue to wait for it to complete.
Description of the reason for the Continue object.
Total duration of the task thus far (seconds).
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Url to access the running task.
Specifies the field to initially sort the grid on. If omitted, no sort is performed initially.
Specifies the field name to initially sort the grid on. i.e. "doc-id"
Specifies the direction to initially sort the grid on. i.e. "ASC" If omitted, default is ascending.
Sort Ascending
Sort Descending

Object used to customize the data returned when requesting a report's data or collection of issues. This object is used by POSTing the XML to either the /data or /issues web services (rather than using GET to return the default data)
Currently Unused. Reserved for column specification.
Specifies the primary sort of the grid.
Specifies the inital grouping of the grid. If omitted, initial view is a flat list.
Specifies the field to initially group the grid on. If omitted, initial view is a flat list.
Specifies the initial filters of the grid. This element is simply a container for one or more "filter" elements.
Specifies an initial filter of the grid.
Specifies the field to filter on.
Specifies the value to filter on. If the "in" attribute is set to true, this field contains a bar '|' delimited list of values to be added to the 'in' clause.If not, it is simply one value.
Specifies whether or not this is a search filter. If omitted, default is "false". If this attribute is set, filter will be executed using a 'LIKE' clause rather than an '=' clause.
Specifies the operation to use on a search filter.
Returns records matching the search string.
Returns records not matching the search string.
Returns records which equal the search string exactly.
Unused in web services. Used only for Web UI purposes.

Specifies whether or not this is an 'in' filter. If omitted, default is "false". If this attribute is set, filter will be executed using a 'in' clause rather than an '=' clause. The list of values is set in the "value" attribute, delimited using the bar '|' character.
Issue object. Not to be instantiated directly.
Parent (Report) ID.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Url of the parent object
Time this issue was first identified by the system.
The last time an issue management action was performed on this issue.
Any comments associated with this issue.
Contains a listing of all jobs which have identified this issue.
Contains advisory information about this issue.
Contains an HTML document describing information about the type of issue encountered.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Represents the severity of an issue

Severity ID.
Available Severities:
Information = 100, Low = 200, Medium = 300, High = 400
Localized name of the current severity set on this issue.
Represents the status of an item

Status ID.
Available Statuses:
Invalid = 0, Open = 1, InProgress = 2, Reopened = 3, Noise = 4, Passed = 5, Fixed = 6
Localized name of the current status set on this issue.
Represents a basic issue (i.e. broken link, spelling mistake)
Contains localized advisory information about this issue.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Contains more detailed information about a basic (non-security) issue.
Contains advisory information about this issue.
Contains information about the stored responses associated with this issue.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Contains information about the stored responses associated with this issue.
Contains information about a single stored response.
Contains information about a stored response associated with this issue.
Contains a collection of highlights for this response to indicate where an issue exists.
Contains the time the response was captured.
Whether or not the response was fully downloaded or not.
Contains the raw HTTP response.
Contains the raw HTTP headers.
Contains the normalized HTTP response.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Contains a collection of highlights for this response to indicate where an issue exists.
Contains information about a single highlight.
Contains the location of a highlight.
XPath to indicate the node in the normalized response to highlight.
Character offset in the raw response to start the highlight.
Length of highlight (use in conjunction with 'offset' to idenfity highlighted portion)
Line number to highlight. If specified, entire line is considered.
Contains more detailed information about a security issue.
Describes the type of issue encountered (advisory and fix recommendations)
Contains a list of all variants which were used to detect this issue.
If the issue is a 'code analysis' (white-box) issue, this element will contain information about how the issue was detected.

If this issue is a 'code analysis' (white-box) issue, this element will list any security issues (black-box) which have also found this problem. If this issue is a security issue, this element will list any 'code analysis' (white-box) issues which have also found this problem.
Note: In order to take advantage of this feature, the 'Correlated Security Issues' report must be included in the report pack along with the Security Issues and Code Analysis Issues report.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Contains a list of all variants which were used to detect this issue.
Contains information about a single security issue variant.
Contains information about a single security issue variant.
Variant ID.
Describes the differences applied between the original request and the mutated request.
Describes the reasons which determined that this security vulnerability exists.
If available, describes the flow of execution through the source code.
If available, shows a snippet of the code in which the JSA issue has been found
Contains HTTP traffic information about this variant.
Contains the test (mutated) HTTP traffic
Contains the original HTTP traffic detected by the scan.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
The id of the cipher suite
The name of the cipher suite
The ssl version of the cipher suite
Describes the reasons which determined that this security vulnerability exists.
Contains a collection of reasons. Reasons will either be static text explaining the reasoning, or a section of the test HTTP traffic which caused the issue to trigger.
Contains a collection of reasons. Reasons will either be static text explaining the reasoning, or a section of the test HTTP traffic which caused the issue to trigger.
Contains a single reason that the issue was triggered.
The type of reason.
Static text describing the reason.

Based on some data found in the test HTTP traffic, it was determined that a security vulnerability exists. The additional attributes on this element describe where in the test traffic the trigger was found.
The name of the current validation info.
The Uri where the test is sent.
Static text describing the reason.
Glassbox analysis has found this vulnerability. The additional attributes on this element provide information about where in source this vulnerability has been found.

Glassbox analysis has found a vulnerability by changing the value of a parameter to this value. The attribute on this element provide the index of the parameter in the input paramters of the identified method. Other information specifying which method this parameter belongs to is given in attributes of the node with type 'appSource'.

Glassbox analysis has found a vulnerability using the part of a given value specified by attributes of this node (index and length). The information about the corresponding parameter and its value is in 'paramValue' node.
Additional data to the variant.
Used only with the 'highlight' reason type, this value is the index into the test traffic where to begin the highlight.

Used only with the 'highlight' reason type, this value indicates the length of the highlight. Together with the 'index' attribute, it can be determined the exact text in the HTTP traffic that caused the issue to trigger.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the Glassbox sink method name.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the sink method parameters for the Glassbox issue.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the type of the return value for the Glassbox issue's sink method.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the Glassbox issue class name.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the Glassbox issue's enclosing method name.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the file name for the Glassbox issue's enclosing method.
Used only with the 'appSource' reason type, this value is the line number of the call to sink method in enclosing method.
Used only with the 'paramValue' reason type, this value is the Glassbox issue's argument index.
Used only with the 'paramSubstring' reason type, this value is the Glassbox issue's highlight start index.
Used only with the 'paramSubstring' reason type, this value is the Glassbox issue's highlight string length.
Describes the differences applied between the original request and the mutated request.
Collection of modifications made to the original request to produce the mutated request.
Collection of modifications made to the original request to produce the mutated request.
A single modification made to the original request
Request Modification ID. This is simply the Variant ID plus and index.
The modified field value used in the mutated request.
The value of the field in the original request.
Describes the type of modification made.
An addition was made to the request.
A change was made to the request.
A removal was made from the request.
No modification was made.
Type of element that was modified.
Indicates that the Path Element was modified.
Indicates that a Parameter Element (either in the query string or body) was modified.
Indicates that a Cookie Element was modified.
Indicates that the Method Element was modified.
Indicates that a Header Element was modified.
Indicates that the entire request body was modified.
Indicates that the entire query string was modified.
Indicates that the Port Element was modified.
Indicates that the Scheme Element was modified.
Indicates that the HTTP version element was modified
Indicates that no modification was done.
The name of the element that was changed.
Describes the type of issue encountered (advisory and fix recommendations)
Name of the vulnerability.
Whether this is an Application or Infrastructure test.
Provides information on the threat class this vulnerability belongs to.
Name of the threat class.
Link to online resource describing the threat class.
Provides a technical description of the vulnerability.
Provides the various causes of this vulnerability to exist.
If available, provides the CVE reference number and link to online reference.
Link to CVE online reference.
Lists the potential security risks of this vulnerability.
Describes a single security risk.
Lists the products which could be affected by this vulnerability.
Lists any additional references.
Link to online reference.
Collection of fix recommendations for resolving this issue.
A single fix recommendation for a given technology.
Type of fix recommendation. 'General' indicates it is a general recommendation for all technologies, or can be for a particular technology (J2EE, .NET, PHP).
Represents a security issue.
Contains more detailed information about a security issue.
Allows for future expansion without affecting current schema.
Contains a listing of all jobs which have identified this issue.

Represents a single source job.

Timestamp indicating the last time this job was run.

An option of a job. The option will contain value and service request of that option.

Collection of option. Contains all possible options of a job.

Collection of available-option. Contains all possible options for service request.
Entry that maps a test server name or pattern to a production server.
This is the test host name or pattern
